intro: Vitex payos var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth vitex, is a shrub native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as scrublands and rocky areas. Its smooth, hairless stems and leaves distinguish it from other varieties within the Vitex genus.
